plural noun.description: The abstract science of number, quantity, and space. Mathematics may be studied in its own right (pure mathematics), or as it is applied to other disciplines such as physics and engineering (applied mathematics).

origin: Late 16th century: plural of obsolete mathematic mathematics, from Old French mathematique, from Latin (ars) mathematica mathematical (art), from Greek mathēmatikē (tekhnē), from the base of manthanein learn.
